title: quarkus-config prints warning 'Unrecognized configuration key...'

labels.name: triage/duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus shows the following warning since 2.8.1.Final when multiple `quarkus.http.auth.permission.authenticated.paths` are present

```
[INFO] --- quarkus-maven-plugin:2.8.1.Final:build (default) @ code-with-quarkus ---
[WARNING] [io.quarkus.config] Unrecognized configuration key "quarkus.http.auth.permission.authenticated.paths[0]" was provided; it will be ignored; verify that the dependency extension for this configuration is set or that you did not make a typo
[WARNING] [io.quarkus.config] Unrecognized configuration key "quarkus.http.auth.permission.authenticated.paths[1]" was provided; it will be ignored; verify that the dependency extension for this configuration is set or that you did not make a typo
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

[reproducer.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/8523030/reproducer.zip)


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

Java 11

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.8.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Maven

### Additional information

_No response_
